intro: Uvifera eggersiana, commonly known as the Eggers' uvilla, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to specific regions in South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile, it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
